intro: Zygophyllidium bilobatum, commonly known as the two-lobed zygophyll, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae, which includes plants adapted to dry environments. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves that are often divided into two lobes. It typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with woody stems and small, leathery leaves. Zygophyllidium bilobatum is well adapted to survive in nutrient-poor soils and can tolerate periods of drought.
